div.sent: Parents, brothers, sisters and other relatives make our family.
If we live alone, our life becomes monotonous.
But if we live together, our life becomes full of joy.
When we do something alone, it takes a long time.
We have learnt these things earlier.
We have also learnt how many types of families are there.
We have learnt what a Christian family is.
We have also learnt their important qualities.
Now, we shall discuss the duties and responsibilities of a Christian Family.
Look at the following picture carefully.
We can see a human body in the picture above.
It has a head, hands, eyes, mouth, nose, belly and legs etc.
All these are different parts of a human body.
These parts are taken together to form a complete body of a human being.
All these parts are inter-connected and they function unitedly.
All of the parts together love the body itself.
One part of it feels for the other one.
For example, if a hand is hurt, the whole body feels pain too.
Each part of the body functions for the whole body.
The ears again listen properly, while the nose smells and breathes.
If any of these does not function well, the whole body suffers.
A family also functions just like this.
In a family we have father, mother, brothers and sisters.
All of them have their own responsibilities.
Again, if any one of them becomes sick, the others look after him or her.
A family is called a Christian family when the parents and children are Christians.
Again, several Christian families of an area can be called a Christian family.
The Christians of a religious community is also called a Christian family.
There are some characteristics of a Christian family.
They lead their lives following the ideals of Jesus Christ.
They love and serve one another.
They also forgive and help one another.
They follow the ideals of the family of Mary, Joseph and Jesus Christ.
The conduct and behaviour of the Christians are modest and tolerant.
They believe one another they discuss matters with one another and come to a decision.
They possess the qualities, such as unity, honesty, simplicity, righteousness and love for peace.
Duties and Responsibilities of the Parents of a Christian Family.
The parents raise their children and teach them the ideals of Christianity;
The parents also follow what they teach their children;
The father and mother respect and love each other;
Everyday they join the family prayers together with their children;
They regularly take part in the prayer of the Church;
They take part and assist in the work of the Church.
Duties and Responsibilities of the Children of a Christian Family.
They respect their parents;
They live together and maintain good relationship with one another;
They respect and obey their parents and elders;
They teach themselves the ideals of Christianity;
They form the habit of praying regularly;
They try to acquire good qualities;
They try their best to give up their bad habits;
They give up laziness and become diligent.
They have their own duties and responsibilities.
In a Christian community the priest conducts the prayer.
The preacher preaches God's messages and the teacher teaches.
The Pastor conducts the prayer moving from house to house in different locality.
Again, some of them nurse the sick while others discuss things with the school children.
Some of them help the poor.
In this way, each of them performs a duty.
Write down the characteristics of ideal children.
Write down the duties and responsibilities you have towards others as an ideal Christian child.
